Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey there, partner. <sp:5:1:0>What's up?<sp:5:1:0> Feeling a
little lonely this evening, are you?
Talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I see you're still awake, partner. <sp:5:1:0>Most
folks are sound asleep at this hour.<sp:5:0:0>
What's up?
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Oh, hello, partner. <sp:5:1:0>What's going on?<sp:5:0:0>
Starting your day feeling a little lonely?
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hello there, partner. <sp:5:1:0>This rain is really
something, isn't it.<sp:5:1:0> Anyway, what's up?
Talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Oh, hey, partner! I didn't think I'd be
running into you here.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>Did you hear how well the articles
investigating the rumors of Princess Zelda
did? Apparently folks really enjoyed them.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>To think we were able to reveal the truth
behind those stories...
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>OK, listen up, partner! We're on the trail
of the truth about Princess Zelda.

We can't let even the smallest clue
slip through our talons. Or hands, in
your case.
We should visit as many stables as we
can. Travelers always have plenty of
goings-on to talk about.
Talk_0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Right, well... Maybe it's not my place to
say, but I think we made a great team.
Our first time working together too!
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>That's the right way to look at it anyway.
But I'll also say...<sp:0:4:0>On any given story, whoever did the
earliest talking with sources probably
gets the most credit for wrapping it up.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>So, which of us was the most helpful
one here?
Talk_0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Without you, I wouldn't have gotten all
the facts for our stories. Hard to look at
myself in the mirror, realizing that.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It'll be good for me to relax in this place.
A famous bard perfected his craft here,
studying the songs of this land.
Besides, our editor, Traysi...<sp:5:0:0> She told me
to take some time off.
Talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Yeah, you're not wrong about that.
You gave it so much effort that it really
put the wind under our wings.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>You really did.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>Then again,<sp:5:0:0> how far could you have
gotten without the chirps and warbles
I got from my sources?
<sp:3:0:2:0701>So maybe I deserve a fair share of the
credit here...
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>So...I'll leave that froggy armor with
you for now.<sp:5:1:0>

...<sp:5:1:0>


<snd:LaughS>What, you think it wouldn't fit me?


<sp:3:0:2:0800>Don't you worry! I could squeeze into
that anytime.
Talk_0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>Hahaha! You think so too, partner?


My zeal for the truth behind a story is
what got us to the answers, that's
for sure!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Heh, aw... Who are we kidding?


<sp:3:0:2:0701>We both know that you were the one who
did most of the heavy lifting, partner!
Talk_0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>True enough. You're not wrong.


<sp:3:0:2:0701>But how far could you have gotten if I
didn't share the chirps and warbles from
my sources? Worth a thought.
Talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Nice of you to keep saying that. But look,
you need to see it from this angle...

On any given story, whoever got the
first questions in with our sources maybe
gets the most credit for where we got.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>So, which of us was the most
essential here?
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'll stay right here and look out across the
land, just like that bard. I'll get in touch
with my reporting instincts!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Determination>Then you bet I'll get my talons on a huge
scoop that will knock you flat on your
tail feathers, partner. You just wait!
Talk_0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well, look at this. You're the one I saw
flying around the sky.

It's great to meet the first one to ever
be launched from a Skyview Tower.
A real historic moment.
Hey, what's your name?
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>A famous bard once perfected his craft in
this place, studying the songs of this land.

I'll stay right here, just like him, and look
out across the land. I'll get in touch with
my reporting instincts!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Determination>You know that I'll be back in action
someday, partner. One half of a great
team—just wait and see!
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Link, you say?<sp:5:1:0> Hold on there...<sp:5:0:0> Really,
your name is Link?

<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Hey, buddy...


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>You've got the same name as that
famous swordsman.<sp:5:1:0> Ha, good for you!<sp:5:1:0>
Pretty big name to live up to though.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm <clr:0000>Penn<clr:ffff>, by the way. I work for the
<clr:0000>Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff>.

I'm writing an article about this event,
so folks everywhere will know about the
Skyview Towers being activated!
I'd better get to work. Our newspaper is
short on staff, so I've had to flap all over
the place to cover the news.
Hey, we could use another reporter!
You should join us. Seem like a brave
type and all—that's what it takes.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Our newspaper is based in <clr:0000>Hebra<clr:ffff> to the
northwest. You'll find it near the bridge
that leads to <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>.
Stop by if you're up for the adventure of
a lifetime...<sp:5:0:0>in the newspaper biz!

Until then...
Talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Mmm. I thought there'd be at least some
clue, but there's nothing...

Hmm?
Talk_0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Mmm. It looks like there's nothing for
us here...

Hmm?
Talk_0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You're really missing our time together,
aren't you?

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Those articles investigating the rumors of
Princess Zelda did well, didn't they.
Apparently folks really enjoyed them.
It makes sense to me though! We made a
pretty perfect team.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:LaughS>We revealed the truth behind a lot of
rumors, partner.
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hello there, partner. <sp:5:1:0>What's up?<sp:5:1:0>
Everyone else is really busy, leaving you
feeling a little lonely?
